basics.name: James Middleton
basics.label: Software Engineer
basics.summary: I'm a full stack web developer with a passion for efficient development and intuitive UX. I thrive in learning from and utilising new technologies to boost my productivity. Being largely self-taught and starting at a young age, commercial experience has helped refine my ability to produce high-quality, production-ready code.

work.name: IMG Arena
work.summary: IMG Arena is a market leader in sports data and media production. My work focusses around maintaining and expanding the Event Centres, embedded in sportsbook websites like bet365 to provide real-time insight into live tournaments. Automated testing using Cypress and React Testing Library is a critical part of CI to ensure high-quality and reliability.
highlights: Initiated collaboration with QA to refactor Cypress tests and improve their readibility
Developed a green-field project for Sales to demo the features of Event Centres
Mentoring a QA colleague to learn React
Being mentoring in Haskell to grow my functional programming skills
Attended workshop to learn GLSL (shading language) fundamentals

work.name: Scrolller
work.summary: Contracted as a freelancer to continue development of Reddit media browser. Collaborated in a start-up environment to boost growth and user experience.
highlights: Introduced TailwindCSS utility-based styles to lift DX
Deployed and integrated self-hosted Matomo analytics to provide insight into user's experience

work.name: Community Brands UK
work.summary: Initially assigned as a backend engineer to continue developing integrations with various school information management systems. Later on I developed a server health dashboard to view issues reported by our data exchange backend, Xporter.
highlights: Created a full-stack server health dashboard using React and C#.NET
Used SQL scripts to further develop third-party school MIS integrations

work.name: ProVQ
work.summary: From conception to production, developed and product managed an apprentice screener system. Liased with key stakeholders and demoed at pre-defined milestones. The tech stack included VueJS, BootstrapVue, FeathersJS, NodeJS and MongoDB.
highlights: Successfully digitised a critical business process, originally paper-based
Developed incrementally to demo progress at project milestones

work.name: a.d.s. computers
work.summary: Constructed workstations tailored to meet customer needs. Provided technical support both in-person and remotely to individuals and SMEs.
highlights: Built a C# script to automatically inject company contact information into Windows OEM

volunteer.summary: Volunteered at a local church mentoring elders to navigate themselves in the digital era.

education.summary: A 3 year bachelors and a Year-in-Enterprise for which I was awarded a Diploma in Professional Studies for ProVQ's project. Mentored numerous peers for programming in Java, PHP and JavaScript. Developed a JS script to create an iCal calendar for any student's timetable. Self-taught VueJS and TypeScript fundamentals.
